text: Hi There - If I accidently mark a module as a global page module is there a way to undo that? I'd like to make it non-global so the contents can be edited.

If you have a module say {% rich_text "rich_text" %} and you have another one on the page I realize you need to call it {% rich_text "rich_text_something_else" %} if you don't want it to be the same.  Is that only page specific? if you have {% rich_text "rich_text" %} on a page template it can contain different content on each page? or do I need to put a page identifier in there
